raw_comment: In the four graphs, I notice that China’s graph is pretty high compared to India and the U.S. The other thing I recognized was how low the graph was for India, considering that the population of India is pretty high. The graph is so low, so that came as a surprise to see. The other thing I noticed was how leveled out the U.S. was in the graph, which was also surprising because even though our population is not as high as India's and China's, we use a lot of those products. I wonder why India's graph is so low for the number of people who live there. I also wonder why China uses much more than India, even though India has a high population. If I were to pick a catchy headline for the graphs, it would be, “The Big Three: Clean and Fossil Fuel.”
ace_sentences: I notice that the graph of China is high compared to the graph of India.
I notice that the graph of China is high compared to the graph of the U.S.
I recognize that the graph of India is low.
The low graph of India surprises me.
I notice that the graph of the U.S. is level.
The level graph of the U.S. surprises me.
The population of the U.S. is not as high as the population of India.
The population of the U.S. is not as high as the population of China.
We use many of these products.
I wonder why the graph of India is so low.
I wonder why China uses much more than India.
The Big Three: Clean and Fossil Fuel.
